One of those companies was Chateaugay Ore and Iron where Bob Linney was superintendent and a mining engineer in 1935 when he was approached by 1932 Olympic gold medal winner Hubert Stevens.

Located in Quebec's Beauharnois County, the city's name was taken from Charles de Salaberry, the British colonel who defeated the Americans at Chateaugay in the War of 1812.
